entry.def: Your subconscious is the part of your mind that can influence you or affect your behaviour even though you are not aware of it.

example.ex: The memory of it all was locked deep in my subconscious.
example.tran: 关于它的一切记忆都深植于我的潜意识里。

entry.def: A subconscious feeling or action exists in or is influenced by your subconscious.

example.ex: He caught her arm in a subconscious attempt to detain her.
example.tran: 他下意识地抓住她的胳膊想挽留她。
潜意识里渴望得到关爱

auth_sentence.content: She had that naughtiness and it was appearing subconsciously.
auth_sentence.res_content: She had that naughtiness and it was appearing subconsciously.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She had that naughtiness and it was appearing subconsciously.

auth_sentence.content: Subconsciously, unconsciously, I was educated, visually.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Subconsciously, unconsciously, I was educated, visually.

auth_sentence.content: So Erica was subconsciously looking for signs of trustworthiness.
auth_sentence.res_content: So Erica was subconsciously looking for signs of trustworthiness.

Sentence.sentence: While the team can't be sure their results are due solely to Obama, they also showed that those with the lowest bias were likely to subconsciously associate black skin colour with political words such as "government" or "president".

sentences.en: In choosing a partner we are subconsciously assessing their evolutionary fitness to be a mother of children or father provider and protector.
sentences.cn: 在选择伴侣的时候，我们会在潜意识里衡量对方将来是否会是称职的母亲或者父亲，是否会是合格的一家之主。
